intro: Campium quoyanum, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments. Campium quoyanum is also known for its ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper humidity and light.
